## Workshop Workflow {background-image="Slides/main.PNG" background-size="contain"}

Previous workshops lasted **c.**45 - 60 mins had a general workflow. Where would Shiny fit in and would it potential distract?

```{mermaid}
flowchart LR
  A(Introduction) --> B{Randomisation}
  B --> C{Practical Experiment}
  C --> D{Data Recording/Entry}
  D --> E{Statistical Analysis}
  E --> F(Conclusion)
```

# Application Design

## Abstract away complexity? {background-image="Slides/main.PNG" background-size="contain"}

Often we want R to carry out complex statistical logic on behalf of users and display some business outcome or aggregated summary to users. However our objective was to showcase this statistical logic!

Should we even be using an Shiny!?

> ...if written and mental arithmetic are secure. In both primary and secondary schools, teachers should use their judgement about when ICT tools should be used[^3]

[^3]: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-mathematics-programmes-of-study accessed on 6th August 2024

## Which Visualisations?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
```{r }
library(ggplot2)
library(palmerpenguins)

ggplot(penguins, aes(x = species, y = flipper_length_mm, fill = species)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Boxplot of Flipper Length by Penguin Species",
       x = "Species",
       y = "Flipper Length (mm)") +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c(
    "Adelie" = "#18213B",
    "Chinstrap" = "#89D8C1",
    "Gentoo" = "#CD8581"
  )) +
  coord_flip()
```

Aligned with curriculum and classroom learning.
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
```{r }
library(ggplot2)
library(palmerpenguins)

ggplot(penguins, aes(x = species, y = flipper_length_mm, fill = species)) +
  geom_violin() +
  labs(title = "Violin of Flipper Length by Penguin Species",
       x = "Species",
       y = "Flipper Length (mm)") +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c(
    "Adelie" = "#18213B",
    "Chinstrap" = "#89D8C1",
    "Gentoo" = "#CD8581"
  )) +
  coord_flip()

```

Tempted... but looks like abstract art to the uninitiated.

# What is Production?

## What is Production?[^5] {background-image="Slides/main.PNG" background-size="contain"}

[^5]: https://engineering-shiny.org/#what-is-production

-   It is [used]{.highlight}, even if only by one person.
-   It is [relied upon]{.highlight} by its user(s).
-   It has [real life impact]{.highlight} if something goes wrong.

::: aside
Definition taken from:
:::

## Constraints {background-image="Slides/main.PNG" background-size="contain"}

-   [Time:]{.highlight} Volunteers with no fixed.
-   [Resources:]{.highlight} No defined budget.
-   [Governance:]{.highlight} Commercial Conflicts & GDPR.
-   [Logistical:]{.highlight} Deployment model.
-   [Known Unknowns:]{.highlight} Different class sizes, equipment, levels of engagement.

## Interactivity

-   Why include interactivity elements to visualisations?
    -   Reinforce learning
    -   Increase classroom engagement
    -   Display technological proficiency
    -   Generational shift in expectations from digital natives
